question_stem:
Quiz 7 - Logistic Regression
Consider using the dataset “churn.csv” to predict if a person will churn (switch) to a different company. A logistic regression model (M1) was formed using the following variables:
Age (years)
Married (0 = Unmarried, 1 = Married)
Cust_years (duration of a customer's relationship with the company)
Churned_contacts (number of customer’s contacts that have churned)
Churned (0 = Didn’t churn, 1 = churned)
Use the following model summary to answer all subsequent questions.

Question 1
Which of the following statements about the model’s construction is correct?
A
It is a must to specify the family argument in glm() as “binomial”
B
It is a must to declare Churned as a factor before forming the model
C
It is a must to declare Married as a factor before forming the model
D
It is a must to scale all features before forming the model
question_stem_html:
Quiz 7 - Logistic Regression
Consider using the dataset “churn.csv” to predict if a person will churn (switch) to a different company. A logistic regression model (M1) was formed using the following variables:
Age (years)
Married (0 = Unmarried, 1 = Married)
Cust_years (duration of a customer's relationship with the company)
Churned_contacts (number of customer’s contacts that have churned)
Churned (0 = Didn’t churn, 1 = churned)
Use the following model summary to answer all subsequent questions.

Question 1
Which of the following statements about the model’s construction is correct?
A
It is a must to specify the family argument in glm() as “binomial”
B
It is a must to declare Churned as a factor before forming the model
C
It is a must to declare Married as a factor before forming the model
D
It is a must to scale all features before forming the model

choices.text: t is a must to declare Churned as a factor before forming the model
